column4: to show something to be false or to hide something such as an emotion
changing mood or behaviour suddenly and unexpectedly
relating to the cerebrum of the brain/involving intelligence rather than emotions or physical
pleasant and friendly/producing a feeling of comfort or satisfaction
very noticeable or attracting attention often in a way that is not wanted/clearly visible
hasty (quick) and probably not detailed
making you feel slightly frightened or worried about your ability to achieve something
intended to teach people a moral lesson
spread (something especially information) widely
possible to do easily or conveniently
to intentionally not obey a rule/ law or custom
consisting of parts or having qualities that are the same
having no excitement/ interest or new and different events
(of food) lacking a strong taste or character or (of people/ activities or entertainment) lacking in interest or energy
Someone who is loquacious talks a lot
not liking other people
a name that is not correct or does not suit what it refers to, or a use of such a name
not being careful or giving enough attention to people or things that are your responsibility
too eager to serve or obey someone
make (someone) less angry or hostile
the fact that someone likes something or likes to do something, especially something considered morally wrong
Of or characteristic of a child/ displaying or suggesting a lack of maturity
having or showing ideas that are different and unusual but not practical or likely to succeed
a person who spends money in an extravagant irresponsible way
tending not to speak much
